title: The Great Australian Bake Off judges are left SPEECHLESS by a crude joke
text:
Foxtel's The Great Australian Bake Off is renowned for being a wholesome, family-friendly show.

But on Thursday, amateur baker Dennis Mews made a crude off-the-cuff remark that left judges Matt Moran and Maggie Beer speechless.

During a cooking challenge, which required the contestants to create an edible biscuit box filled with 12 biscuits, the 71-year-old joked about his 'erections'.

Whoops! The Great Australian Bake Off's Dennis Mews (pictured) made a crude off-the-cuff remark on Thursday's episode that left judges Matt Moran and Maggie Beer speechless

'I'm very pleased I got to construct it without it collapsing,' Dennis said, referring to his edible draughts set, complete with board, pieces and biscuit box.

He continued: 'If I may say, my last two erections have been a big disappointment!'

After Dennis' cheeky double entendre, Matt and Maggie appeared momentarily lost for words before bursting into laughter.

Speechless: While discussing the structural integrity of his latest baking project, Dennis told the judges, 'My last two erections have been a big disappointment!'

He said what?! After Dennis' cheeky double entendre, Matt and Maggie appeared momentarily lost for words before bursting into laughter

'Sorry, we're going to need a cup of tea for Maggie!' joked co-host Mel Buttle, before adding: 'Maggie, talk about Dennis' erection please!'

Dennis then smiled at the judges, who were unable to make eye contact with him, as the other contestants giggled in the background.

Despite his amusing slip of the tongue, Dennis' culinary creation failed to secure him a place in the top nine and he was eliminated later in the episode.

Oh no he didn't! Dennis then smiled at the judges, who were unable to make eye contact with him, as the other contestants giggled in the background

Maggie said she was 'really sad' to see Dennis go, while Matt predicted his 'erection' joke would go down in history as one of the funniest moments on Australian TV.

Dennis was the third person to be eliminated from the popular baking show, in which contestants battle it out for the coveted title of Australia's Best Amateur Baker.

The Great Australian Bake Off airs on Foxtel's Lifestyle every Thursday at 8.30pm
description: Foxtel's The Great Australian Bake Off is renowned for being a wholesome, family-friendly show - but that wasn't the case on Thursday
authors: Mark Brook For Daily Mail Australia
